intro: Ranunculus hyperboreus subsp. arnellii, commonly known as the Arctic buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to eight petals, typically blooming in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are adapted to cold climates. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
